name: SBObject
desc: The SBObject class declares methods that can be invoked on any object in a scriptable application. It defines methods for getting elements and properties of an object, as well as setting a given object to a new value.

items.name: init()
items.desc: Initializes and returns an instance of an SBObject subclass.

items.name: init(data: Any)
items.desc: Returns an instance of an SBObject subclass initialized with the given data.

items.name: init(properties: [AnyHashable : Any])
items.desc: Returns an instance of an SBObject subclass initialized with the specified properties.

items.name: init(elementCode: DescType, properties: [String : Any]?, data: Any?)
items.desc: Returns an instance of an SBObject subclass initialized with the specified properties and data and added to the designated element array.

items.name: func get() -> Any?
items.desc: Forces evaluation of the receiver, causing the real object to be returned immediately.

items.name: func setTo(Any?)
items.desc: Sets the receiver to a specified value.

items.name: func property(with: AnyClass, code: AEKeyword) -> SBObject
items.desc: Returns an object of the designated scripting class representing the specified property of the receiver

items.name: func property(withCode: AEKeyword) -> SBObject
items.desc: Returns an object representing the specified property of the receiver.

items.name: func elementArray(withCode: DescType) -> SBElementArray
items.desc: Returns an array containing every child of the receiver with the given class-type code.
